title: What is KP?
description: KP is usually a bumpy rash that develops on the upper outer arms, upper thighs and cheeks. It has been widely known as “chicken skin”. KP may be accompanied by itching in some individuals, but as a rule, the reaction develops without visible signs. Sometimes this itching may lead to Eczema which could be assisted by using KP lotions.

title: How do I use KP lotion?
description: Apply KP lotion right after bathing when your skin is still moist.

title: When can I expect the results?
description: You should start to see improvement in two to four weeks if you follow your treatment plan.

title: What does KP lotion do?
description: KP lotion, also known as topical exfoliants, helps remove dead skin cells, moisturize, and soften dry skin. It contains ingredients like lactic acid, salicylic acid, urea, or alpha hydroxy acid.
